description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5dm10","text":"Here, we present a CellProfiler (1) software pipeline to quantify the density and intensity of dopaminergic processes in the mouse striatum. The dopaminergic processes in the striatum are stained using an anti-tyrosine hydroxylase antibody and the same sections are also stained using an antibody that recognizes total neuronal NeuN (neuronal nuclear antigen biomarker) for staining normalization. For the examples shown herein, images were acquired using a Zeiss LSM 900 laser scanning confocal microscope with a 63X 1.4 oil immersion objective.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"768ms","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8snvq","text":"(1) Stirling DR, Swain-Bowden MJ, Lucas AM, Carpenter AE, Cimini BA, Goodman A (2021). CellProfiler 4: improvements in speed, utility and usability. BMC Bioinformatics, 22 (1), 433. PMID: 34507520 PMCID: PMC8431850.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"9faj7","text":"1)\t.czi files from Zeiss Laser Scanning Microscope","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s0b7","text":"2)\tFIJI/imageJ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"750hc","text":"3)\tCellProfiler software 4.04 or later*","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnhf2","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"alm78","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9f82b","text":"*Stirling DR, Swain-Bowden MJ, Lucas AM, Carpenter AE, Cimini BA, Goodman A (2021). CellProfiler 4: improvements in speed, utility and usability. BMC Bioinformatics, 22 (1), 433. PMID: 34507520 PMCID: PMC8431850.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: CellProfiler computational pipeline to quantify the density of mouse striatal dopaminergic processes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1h30d","text":"Batch process images","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7305d","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0934","text":"1. Use the FIJI macro as described in dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.3byl4bpo8vo5/v1 to Z project the .czi images obtained from Zeiss LSM microscope. Open the images that need to be processed, choose the output folder, run code for maximum intensity Z projection, and save the file as .TIFF.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":38,"length":48}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":37,"length":49}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A33AF045460D11EF98F80A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.3byl4bpo8vo5/v1"}}}}

steps.section: CellProfiler computational pipeline to quantify the density of mouse striatal dopaminergic processes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"epq03","text":"Import files and extract metadata","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"944f8","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38d8h","text":"1. Open CellProfiler. Go to the Images module, drag and drop the maximum intensity projected .TIFF files as indicated. Select “no filtering” in the filter images option.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vang","text":"2. Go to the Metadata module to extract information describing the images.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c67tr","text":"In the Metadata module:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7u65","text":"a)\tExtract metadata? Yes","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80hti","text":"b)\tMetadata extraction method: Extract from image file headers      ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bu11m","text":"c)\tExtract metadata from: All images","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3o81i","text":"d)\tHit “Extract metadata”","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7551m","text":"e)\tClick on Add another extraction method","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcbi7","text":"f)  \tMetadata extraction method: Extract from file/folder names","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jl49","text":"g)\tMetadata source: File name","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"foje3","text":"h)\tRegular expression to extract from file name:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cg8de","text":" ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgbdo","text":" “Regex” will be as follows:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6detu","text":"^.*br(?P\u003cBrain_number\u003e[0-9]{1,2}).*#(?P\u003cimage_number\u003e[0-9]{2})for an example file name “br1-01.czi - br1-01.czi #01_max.tif”. This step helps to extract the brain number, and image number from each file name.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gq6m","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ed72m","text":"In Regex,","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93v7r","text":"^ indicates the beginning of the file name.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"atupc","text":"(?P\u003cBrain_number\u003e[0-9]{1,2} tells the program to name the captured field “Brain_number” and recognize one or two digits that follow.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gpmo","text":".* indicates any character.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6jvvl","text":"(?P\u003cimage_number\u003e[0-9]{2}) tells the program to name the captured field “image_number” and recognize two digits that follow. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1fjst","text":"Click the magnifying glass icon on the right to check the accuracy of regular expression.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cpm3f","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1sg1v","text":"i)  \tMetadata data type: Text","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vgb3","text":"j)  \tClick on “update” to populate the metadata field","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ff3c9","text":" ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"727h","text":"3. Go to the NamesAndTypes module to give a name to each channel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ddn3a","text":"a)\tAssign a name to: Images matching rules","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9a77","text":"b)\tProcess as 3D: steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"350l8","text":"Density measurement","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hgof","text":" ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdcfn","text":"The following steps are used to binarize the images by separating the foreground and background in an image and measuring the area occupied by the foreground in the image.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6pcdt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rfms","text":"1. To binarize the images, click on the “+” sign at the bottom left next to Adjust Modules. Under the module category, click Image processing, then choose Threshold module. Click Add to pipeline.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9pcmf","text":"a)\tSelect the input image: TyrosineHydroxylase","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"au4qk","text":"b)\tName the output image: Thresholded_TyrosineHydroxylase","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"alcjb","text":"c)\tThreshold strategy: Global","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4eee8","text":"d)\tThresholding method: Minimum Cross-Entropy","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4osb5","text":"e)\tThreshold smoothing scale: 0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8uugf","text":"f)  \tThreshold correction factor: 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1tre","text":"g)\tLower and upper bounds on threshold: 0.2 and 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8sfsg","text":"h)\tLog transform before thresholding: Yes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gagb","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhvfl","text":"Note: Check by clicking “Start Test Mode” and select the green triangle next to the Threshold module each time a parameter is changed to find the best parameters for each image set.
